key_points: Gisele Bündchen and Tom Brady discuss his past Super Bowl experiences, focusing on Super Bowl XLVI in 2012.
Bündchen defended Brady with a heated comment after the Patriots' loss to the Giants, saying, "My husband cannot f---ing throw the ball and catch the ball at the same time."
The comment was made in response to hecklers post-game and was widely perceived as a dig at Brady's teammates.
Bündchen recounted feeling extremely nervous during the game, resorting to drinking wine to calm her nerves.
After the game, hecklers provoked Bündchen, leading to her infamous remark.
Tom Brady initially told Bündchen that she shouldn't have made the comment.
Bündchen stands by her comment, clarifying it wasn't directed at any teammate in particular, but was misconstrued as an attack on Wes Welker.
Wes Welker expressed understanding of Bündchen's comment, knowing where her heart was.
In 2019, Brady humorously engaged with the controversy by posting a video of himself catching his own pass, to which Bündchen commented.
The couple's reflections are part of episode five of the ESPN+ series Man in the Arena: Tom Brady.
